channel.title: Girls Who Code at UNC Charlotte
channel.description: Recent content on Girls Who Code at UNC Charlotte

item.title: Web Project '22
item.description: WE DID IT! As of May 2nd, 2022, our GWC Web Team has officially launched this new website for our organization! You can see all of the amazing people involved in this project and learn more about the process below.

item.title: Launch Party
item.description: We had so much fun at our Launch Party! üéâ Thank you to everyone who joined us in celebrating our new website launch and congratulating our Web Team members.

item.title: Portfolios
item.description: A portfolio is a compilation of things that show your previous work, projects, skills, etc. It helps you go beyond just listing your work history by showing things like specific pieces of work you have created.

item.title: Operating Systems
item.description: An operating system is the software on your computer that runs all other applications. It allows you to communicate with the computer without having to know how to speak or use the computer’s language.

item.title: Hackathons
item.description: A hackathon is essentially a short period of time to build a project, typically with a team. These projects, or ‘hacks,’ are usually created to offer a solution to some type of problem.

item.title: Command Line Interfaces
item.description: A Command Line Interface, or CLI, is a “text-based user interface (UI) used to run programs, manage computer files and interact with the computer.” Learn more about CLIs and check out resources from our Command Line Games event that GWC hosted!

item.title: Interviewing & Internships
item.description: Interviews and internships are an important part of everyone’s career journeys. Girls Who Code has had a few events on these topics like how to prepare and panels on other’s interviewing or internship experiences.

item.title: Git & GitHub
item.description: If you want to develop things, Git is an important software to know and GitHub is a great Git hosting site. Girls Who Code has hosted several workshops involving these two topics, and you can find all materials here.

item.title: UNCC Resources
item.description: UNC Charlotte has many resources for all sorts of things. It can be hard to realize just how many things are available to you as a student here, especially as a freshman or transfer student.

item.title: Web Development
item.description: Web development is such a great topic to explore nowadays, for everything from building your own portfolio to creating websites or webapps for businesses, clubs, games, etc.

item.title: Internship Panel
item.description: We learned some great insights about internships on Friday! We want to give a huge thank you to our wonderful panelists¬†Akshithaa Suresh,¬†Maryalina Shipley, and¬†Quin Chapman¬†for their time and sharing their experiences and knowledge with us.

item.title: Venture Event
item.description: What a fun outdoor bonding experience! ‚òÄÔ∏è We want to give a huge shoutout to Kaitlyn Gosline for organizing this event with Venture Outdoor Leadership, and a huge thank you to all those who joined us on Friday!

item.title: Axe Hacks '22
item.description: What a week! üéâ Thank you all for making our VERY FIRST Axe Hacks so special! We had so much fun getting to know our Hackers and Mentors throughout the week, playing games, learning new tools and languages, and more.
